SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Without timely treatment, fetal atrial flutter (AF) could result in congestive heart failure, hydrops fetalis and even fetal demise
METHODS: Prenatal echocardiography was used to confirm AF and assess fetal cardiac function with cardiovascular profile score
Transplacental digoxin therapy was adopted, and the patient was followed up for 10 months
RESULTS: The healthy male baby was delivered with normal postnatal electrocardiogram and echocardiogram
Neither arrhythmia nor neurodevelopmental impairment was found during the follow-up
CONCLUSION: Timely transplacental digoxin therapy can successfully treat fetal AF and allow the fetus to recover from AF associated fetal heart failure and hydrops fetalis prior to delivery
